column1: This course familiarizes students with quality children's literature for infancy through young adulthood.  Students will select, discuss, critique, and share books appropriate for this age span, focusing primarily on ages 5-14 years.  The influences of child development, culture, technology, and education stakeholders (i.e., parents, students, teachers, administrators, and their community) on literature selection are emphasized.  Students will develop skills in evaluating books, responding to books, and  using literature across the curriculum.
